title: Git Secret Handling Workflow (Updated 2026-02-12)
content:
Git Secret Handling Workflow (Updated 2026-02-12)

**Mandatory 4-step process for ALL git commits:**
1. Check .gitignore FIRST (ensure secret patterns covered)
2. Stage selectively (NEVER `git add .`)
3. Verify no secrets (`git diff --cached | grep patterns`)
4. Commit with clear message

**Documentation placeholders (avoid scanner):**
- `ANTHROPIC_PREFIX_*` (not actual ANTHROPIC_KEY_PATTERN)
- `OPENAI_PREFIX_*` (not actual OPENAI_KEY_PATTERN)
- `authorization token` (not "AUTH_HEADER")

title: mem0 GoogleEmbedder Bug (Added 2026-02-15)

**Fix:** Edit `/root/.openclaw/extensions/openclaw-mem0/node_modules/mem0ai/dist/oss/index.js` ~line 2250
**Change:** `contents: text` ‚Üí `contents: [{ parts: [{ text: text }] }]`
**WARNING:** Fix does NOT persist across npm reinstalls - must reapply after `npm install`

title: Cloudflare Deploy Lesson Learned
content:
Cloudflare Deploy Lesson Learned

**Problem:** I told Brian I couldn't deploy because the token was invalid/expired. Wasted his time.

**Reality:** The token (Account API) is READ-ONLY. Wrangler CLI direct upload fails, but API trigger works fine.

**Solution - 3 Fallback Methods (COMMANDMENT #35):**
1. **API Trigger** (PREFERRED): `curl -X POST .../deployments -F branch=master` - triggers rebuild FROM GitHub
2. **Git Push**: Empty commit + push to trigger auto-deploy  
3. **Wrangler CLI**: Dire

title: Add message search and export - conversation discovery and archiving
content:
**User Story:**
As a Mobileclaw user, I want to search my message history and export conversations so that I can find information quickly and keep records of important discussions.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Search functionality:
  - Full-text search across all messages
  - Search within specific conversations or globally
  - Real-time search results as user types
  - Highlighting of search terms in results
  - Search by:
    - Message text content
    - Sender name
    - Date range
    - Conversation title
    - Attachments (file names)
  - Advanced filters (combine multiple criteria)
  - Search history (recent searches)
  - Quick filters (today, this week, unread, favorites)
- Search UI:
  - Search bar prominently placed
  - Results displayed with context (preview, timestamp)
  - Tap result to jump to message in conversation
  - Clear visual indication of search matches
  - Empty state when no results found
  - Loading indicator during search
- Export functionality:
  - Export entire conversation or date range
  - Export formats:
    - Plain text (.txt)
    - JSON (structured data)
    - CSV (spreadsheet-compatible)
    - PDF (formatted, shareable)
  - Include/exclude:
    - Attachments
    - Metadata (timestamps, status)
    - Deleted messages
  - Share exported file via system share sheet
  - Email export directly from app
- Export options:
  - Single conversation or multiple conversations
  - Select specific messages to export
  - Batch export (all conversations)
  - Schedule automatic backups
- Performance:
  - Search completes in <1 second for 10,000+ messages
  - Indexed search using SQLite FTS (Full-Text Search)
  - Background export without blocking UI
  - Progress indicator for large exports
- Privacy:
  - Exported files are stored securely
  - Option to password-protect exports
  - Clear warning before sharing sensitive conversations
  - Automatic deletion of temporary export files

title: Implement local message storage (SQLite) - conversation persistence
content:
**User Story:**
As a Mobileclaw user, I want my chat history stored locally so that I can access past conversations even when offline and have my messages persist across app restarts.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- SQLite database implementation:
  - Messages table with schema (id, conversationId, text, sender, timestamp, status, attachments, metadata)
  - Conversations table (id, title, lastMessage, lastActivity, participantCount)
  - Efficient indexing for fast queries (timestamp, conversationId)
  - Database migrations system for schema updates
- Storage features:
  - Store all sent and received messages
  - Store conversation metadata (title, participants, settings)
  - Store message status (sent, delivered, read, failed)
  - Store attachments references (file paths, URLs)
  - Automatic cleanup of old messages (configurable retention policy)
- Query capabilities:
  - Retrieve messages by conversation
  - Paginated message loading (50 messages at a time)
  - Search messages by text content
  - Filter by date range, sender, or conversation
  - Sort by timestamp (ascending/descending)
  - Count unread messages per conversation
- Performance:
  - Fast queries (<50ms for typical operations)
  - Efficient bulk inserts (batch writes)
  - Background sync without blocking UI
  - Database optimization (VACUUM, ANALYZE)
- Data integrity:
  - Atomic transactions for consistency
  - Error handling and recovery
  - Data validation before insert/update
  - Backup and restore functionality
- Works offline:
  - All operations work without internet
  - Sync with server when connection available
  - Conflict resolution for concurrent updates
- Privacy and security:
  - Optional encryption for sensitive messages
  - Secure deletion (overwrite data)
  - Export conversations (JSON, CSV)

title: Build OpenClaw Chat UI - message bubbles, input, history
content:
**User Story:**
As a Mobileclaw user, I want a chat interface to communicate with OpenClaw AI so that I can get AI assistance directly from my mobile device.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Chat UI includes:
  - Message bubbles (user vs AI, distinct styling with clear visual separation)
  - Text input field with send button
  - Message history (scrollable, persisted locally)
  - Timestamps for each message
  - Message status indicators (sending, sent, delivered, error)
  - Typing indicator when AI is responding
  - Avatar/profile images for user and AI
- Features:
  - Send text messages with smooth animations
  - View full message history with infinite scroll
  - Delete individual messages or entire conversations
  - Copy messages to clipboard
  - Long-press for message options
  - Pull-to-refresh message history
- UI design:
  - Follows platform conventions (iOS/Android Material Design)
  - Smooth keyboard behavior (auto-focus input, dismiss on scroll)
  - Responsive layout (adapts to different screen sizes)
  - Dark/light mode support
  - Accessibility compliant (screen reader support, proper contrast)
- Performance:
  - Smooth scrolling with 1000+ messages
  - Efficient rendering (virtualized list)
  - No lag when typing or sending messages
- Works offline:
  - Show queued messages when offline
  - Auto-send when connection restored
  - Visual indicator for offline state
- Follows design spec with 20 UX tests passing ‚â•85%

title: Kanban Mobile UX: Prevent card modal opening while scrolling (tap vs scroll threshold)
content:
**Problem:** On mobile, the kanban cards are overly sensitive: the card modal pops up while the user is scrolling down the list.

**User Impact:**
- Scrolling becomes frustrating / unusable
- Accidental modal opens cause context loss
- Feels "jittery" and broken on touch devices

**Root Cause (likely):**
- Click/tap handler fires even when the gesture is a scroll
- No movement threshold / gesture discrimination
- Potential use of `touchend`/`click` without checking `touchmove`

**Fix Requirements:**
1. **Tap vs Scroll Discrimination**
   - Track `touchstart` position/time
   - If finger moves > **10‚Äì15px** (configurable), treat as scroll ‚Üí **do not open modal**
   - Only open modal if:
     - movement <= threshold AND
     - duration <= 500ms (optional) AND
     - no active scroll inertia

2. **Pointer Events Support (preferred)**
   - Use `pointerdown/pointermove/pointerup` when available
   - Fallback to touch/mouse events
   - Ensure handlers are `passive: true` where appropriate (move), but modal open on `pointerup`

3. **Stop Ghost Clicks**
   - After scroll gesture detected, suppress subsequent `click` (e.g., set a short-lived flag for 300ms)

4. **UX Polish**
   - Keep card tap responsive when user intends to open modal
   - No regressions on desktop (mouse click should still open modal)

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- On iPhone/Android, scrolling through cards does **not** open modals
- Intentional taps reliably open modal
- Works in Safari iOS + Chrome Android
- No console errors

**Test Cases:**
- Slow scroll through list (no modals)
- Fast flick scroll (no modals)
- Tap card while stationary (modal opens)
- Tap small movement (<10px) (modal opens)
- Long press then scroll (no modal)
- Desktop click (modal opens)

**Priority:** HIGH (mobile usability)
**Estimate:** 1‚Äì2 hours

title: TPUSA Intel: Integrate last30days skill for live research and content discovery
content:
**User Story:**

**Current State:**
- Site: https://swordtruth-tpusa-intel.netlify.app/
- Status: Basic skeleton with "Loading content..." placeholders
- No search functionality
- No skills integration
- Static content only

**Target Features:**

1. **Live Research Search**
   - Input: Search query (e.g., "Tyler Bowyer AZGOP", "Erica Kirk corruption")
   - Backend: Calls last30days skill with topic
   - Output: Recent content from Reddit + X + Web (last 30 days)
   - Display: Cards showing source, engagement (upvotes/likes), link, excerpt

2. **Search Interface**
   - Search bar with depth control (quick/default/deep)
   - Real-time loading indicator during research
   - Results organized by source (Reddit tab, X tab, Web tab)
   - Sort by: Engagement, Recency, Relevance

3. **Content Cards**
   - Source badge (Reddit/X/Web with icon)
   - Engagement metrics (upvotes/likes/shares)
   - Timestamp (relative, e.g., "2 days ago")
   - Title + excerpt (first 200 chars)
   - "View Full" link to original source
   - Save to collection button

4. **Trending Topics**
   - Auto-run searches for key TPUSA figures on page load
   - Pre-populate "Targets" section with:
     ‚Ä¢ Tyler Bowyer
     ‚Ä¢ Erica Kirk
     ‚Ä¢ Andrew Kolvet
     ‚Ä¢ Mikey McCoy
     ‚Ä¢ Charlie Kirk
   - Show engagement trends (up/down arrows)

5. **Skills Organization Panel**
   - List all available research skills
   - Show last30days config (API keys status)
   - Quick-launch buttons for common queries
   - Skill usage stats (searches run, sources checked)

**Technical Requirements:**
- Backend: Python Flask API or Cloudflare Worker
- Skill integration: Call last30days skill via subprocess or API wrapper
- Caching: 6-hour cache for identical queries (reduce API costs)
- Rate limiting: Max 10 searches/hour per user
- Storage: Save results to JSON files for "Latest" feed
- Error handling: Show friendly errors if APIs fail

**API Dependencies:**
- OpenAI API (Reddit search)
- xAI API or Bird CLI (X search)
- Brave Search API (web search)
- All keys already in /root/.openclaw/secrets/keys.env

**Deliverables:**
1. Backend API endpoint: POST /api/research
2. Frontend search UI with results display
3. Skills panel showing available research tools
4. Trending topics auto-populated
5. Latest content feed (cached results)
6. Documentation: API usage, rate limits, caching

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Search executes last30days skill and returns results in <30 seconds
- Results display with source, engagement, timestamp, excerpt
- Trending topics refresh every 6 hours automatically
- Skills panel shows all available research capabilities
- Site works on mobile (responsive design)
- Error handling: graceful degradation if APIs fail
- Performance: Lighthouse score ‚â•90

title: Database Analysis: Current Setup vs Supabase Free Tier
content:
**User Story:**
As the system architect, I want to analyze our current database usage vs Supabase free tier so that we can determine if migration would improve performance or accuracy.

**Analysis Required:**
- Current databases in use (mem0/Kuzu, Supermemory, file-based)
- Current performance metrics (query speed, storage)
- Supabase free tier capabilities
- Migration complexity assessment
- Performance improvement estimates
- Cost/benefit analysis

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Given the current system uses mem0/Kuzu, Supermemory, and file-based storage
- When I complete the analysis
- Then I produce DATABASE-ANALYSIS-2026-02-12.md containing:
  - Inventory of current data stores and what each is used for
  - Current performance characteristics and constraints
  - Supabase free tier limits relevant to our usage
  - Migration options and complexity/risk assessment
  - Estimated impact on performance, correctness, and cost
  - A clear recommendation (migrate / do not migrate / partial migrate) with rationale
- Given assumptions are required due to missing metrics
- When I make estimates
- Then I document assumptions and how to validate them

**Deliverable:** DATABASE-ANALYSIS-2026-02-12.md with recommendation

title: Add Usage Tracking & Cost Analysis to Mission Control
content:
**User Story:**
As a user, I want to track token usage, message counts, and costs in Mission Control so that I can see spending trends and optimize for cost.

**Features:**
- Usage log (provider, model, tokens, task type, cost)
- Questions answered:
  - How much did I spend this week?
  - Which workflows cost the most?
  - Show me the 30-day trend
- Reports:
  - Cost breakdown by task type and provider
  - Spending trend over time
  - Routing suggestions (use cheaper models for simple tasks)
- Saves money without sacrificing quality

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Given Mission Control receives usage events (provider, model, tokens, task type, cost)
- When a request completes
- Then a usage record is stored with enough data to compute totals and trends
- Given I open the usage/cost analysis area
- When data exists for the selected time range
- Then I can see:
  - Total spend for the range
  - Breakdown by provider and task type
  - A 30-day trend visualization
- Given there is no data for a selected range
- When I view the report
- Then I see a clear empty state (no errors)
- Given a provider/model price table changes or is missing
- When cost is computed
- Then the system either uses the correct price or flags the record as "unknown cost" without breaking reports

**Reference:** Image from 2026-02-12 showing usage tracking architecture

title: Fix Mission Control - Non-functional Notification & Settings Icons
content:
**User Story:**
As a user, I want the notification and settings icons in the Mission Control top bar to work so that I can access these features.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Notification icon (bell) opens notification panel
- Settings icon (gear) opens settings panel
- Both icons have proper event handlers

title: Implement Multi-Query Expansion for Better Recall
content:
**User Story:**
As a memory system, I want to generate query variations (3 per query) so that different phrasings and abbreviations are caught (e.g., CF = Cloudflare).

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Generate 3 query variations using LLM
- Run parallel searches for all variations
- Deduplicate and merge results
- Rerank combined results
- Test: 3x search cost (parallelizable)

**Reference:** SEMANTIC-SEARCH-IMPROVEMENTS-SIMULATIONS.md #4
**Priority:** ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê High

title: Implement Hash-Based Deduplication for Memory Storage
content:
**User Story:**
As a memory system, I want to deduplicate memories using content hashing so that duplicate memories are merged with updated timestamps and tags.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Hash memory content (SHA-256)
- Check for existing hash before storing
- Merge timestamps and tags if duplicate found
- Clean up existing duplicates
- Code: ~50 lines

**Reference:** SEMANTIC-SEARCH-IMPROVEMENTS-SIMULATIONS.md #1
**Priority:** ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê Critical
**Quick Win:** Simple implementation, high impact

title: Implement Graph Context Expansion for Memory Retrieval
content:
**User Story:**
As a memory system, I want to traverse the mem0 graph DB to discover related memories so that context is automatically expanded.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Use mem0's existing Kuzu graph DB (already have infrastructure!)
- Implement graph traversal queries (1-2 hops)
- Return connected memories with hop distance scoring
- Code: ~50 lines (just query logic)

**Reference:** SEMANTIC-SEARCH-IMPROVEMENTS-SIMULATIONS.md #6
**Priority:** ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê Critical
**Quick Win:** Infrastructure already exists!

title: Implement Reranking with Cross-Encoder for Memory Search
content:
**User Story:**
As a memory system, I want to rerank semantic search results with a cross-encoder so that false positives (e.g., Cloudflare matching Netlify) are eliminated.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Integrate cross-encoder model (ms-marco-MiniLM-L-6-v2)
- Rerank top 20 candidates from semantic search
- Return top 5 after reranking
- Model size: 80MB
- Code: ~80 lines

**Reference:** SEMANTIC-SEARCH-IMPROVEMENTS-SIMULATIONS.md #3
**Priority:** ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê Critical

title: Implement Hybrid Search (BM25 + Semantic) for Memory System
content:
**User Story:**
As a memory system, I want to combine keyword search (BM25) with semantic search so that exact matches (US-118, API keys, URLs) are caught while preserving semantic understanding.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Implement BM25 keyword search index
- Implement Reciprocal Rank Fusion (RRF) to merge keyword + semantic results
- Test with exact match queries (task IDs, API keys, URLs)
- Benchmark: 5-10x improvement in search quality
- Code: ~100 lines

**Reference:** SEMANTIC-SEARCH-IMPROVEMENTS-SIMULATIONS.md #10
**Priority:** ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê Critical

title: Fix mobile card click - no description shown
content:
**User Story:**
As a mobile kanban board user, I want tapping a card to show its full description/details so that I can read and act on tasks from my phone.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Given I am on a mobile viewport and the board shows cards
- When I tap a card
- Then a details view opens showing the full task description (including user story/acceptance criteria if present)
- Given the description is long
- When I view details
- Then I can scroll to read the entire content
- Given I close the details view
- When I return to the board
- Then I can continue interacting with other cards normally

**Notes / Context:**
On mobile, clicking cards does not show description; touch handlers may be missing; critical.

title: Fix hamburger menu overlap on mobile
content:
**User Story:**
As a mobile kanban board user, I want the hamburger/menu icon positioned without covering content so that I can navigate without losing access to cards.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Given I am on a mobile viewport
- When the board renders
- Then the hamburger/menu icon does not overlap task cards or key content
- Given I scroll the board
- When the header/menu remains visible or sticky
- Then it still does not cover card content or intercept taps intended for cards
- Given I open and close the hamburger/menu
- When it closes
- Then the board returns to a fully interactive state (no invisible overlay)

**Notes / Context:**
Hamburger menu overlaps/covering task cards on mobile; severity critical.

title: Fix mobile light mode - black header bug
content:

As a mobile kanban board user, I want the header to use correct light-mode styling so that the interface remains readable and consistent with the selected theme.

- Given I am on a mobile viewport and the board is in light mode
- When the page loads
- Then the top header background uses a light color (not black) and text remains readable
- Given I toggle from dark mode to light mode (or vice versa)
- When the theme changes
- Then the header updates immediately to match the selected theme
- Given I navigate between board views/pages (if applicable)
- When the header persists across navigation
- Then it remains correctly themed in all views

**Notes / Context:**
Top header shows black background in light mode on mobile; severity critical.

Integrate Test Agent + Code Review with Kanban Board
content:
**User Story:**
As a project owner, I want findings from the Test Agent and Code Review Agent to automatically create or update kanban tasks so that the board reflects the true current workload without manual transcription.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Given the Test Agent produces new bug findings
- When the integration runs
- Then new bug items are created on the kanban board (or existing ones updated) with enough detail to reproduce and verify
- Given the Code Review Agent identifies issues or required changes
- When the integration runs
- Then review items are represented as tasks on the board with clear ownership and acceptance criteria
- Given the integration encounters duplicates (same bug/task already exists)
- When syncing
- Then it updates the existing task rather than creating a duplicate, or links to the original
- Given integration fails (file missing, parse error, permission issue)
- When it runs
- Then it logs a clear error and does not corrupt tasks.json

**Notes / Context:**
Brian asked why new bugs aren't being added to the board. Current: agents write to BUGS/*.md; not integrated into tasks.json.

title: Kanban: Display Unique ID in Top Right Corner
content:
**User Story:**
As a kanban board user, I want to see a unique identifier on each card so that I can reference tasks unambiguously in conversations, bug reports, and commits.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Given the board renders a list of task cards
- When I view any card
- Then I can see a unique identifier in the card's top-right corner
- Given a card has both a story number (e.g., US-001) and an internal numeric id
- When the identifier is displayed
- Then the displayed id is stable, unique across cards, and suitable for copy/paste referencing
- Given I add a new card
- When it appears on the board
- Then it also shows a unique id without requiring refresh

**Notes / Context:**
Brian requested a unique id # in the top right corner. Existing data includes storyNumber and internal id.

title: CRITICAL: Drag-Drop STILL Broken (2nd Report)
content:
**User Story:**
As a kanban board user, I want to drag and drop cards between columns so that I can manage work status efficiently.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Given I can see a card in the Backlog column
- When I drag the card to the Next Up column and drop it
- Then the card appears in Next Up and is removed from Backlog
- Given drag-and-drop completes
- When I refresh the page
- Then the card remains in the destination column (state persisted)
- Given I attempt drag-and-drop on both desktop (mouse) and mobile/touch (if supported)
- When I perform the gesture
- Then the interaction either works or presents a clear non-supported message (no silent failure)
- Given an earlier fix was attempted
- When I repeat the reported failing scenario
- Then drag-and-drop succeeds for at least Backlog ‚Üí Next Up and Next Up ‚Üí Active transitions

**Notes / Context:**
Brian reported (second time) cannot drag cards from Backlog to Next Up; previous commit a64f5d7 claimed fix but still broken.

title: Kanban Desktop: Move Hamburger to Top Left
content:
**User Story:**
As a desktop kanban board user, I want the hamburger/menu button positioned so it doesn't obstruct primary actions so that I can add cards and use navigation without accidental clicks.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Given I am using the kanban board on a desktop viewport
- When the board header renders
- Then the hamburger/menu button is placed in the top-left area (or otherwise non-overlapping) and does not cover the "New Card" / add-task control
- Given I resize the browser window across common desktop widths
- When layout recalculates
- Then the hamburger/menu button remains accessible and does not overlap actionable UI
- Given I click the hamburger/menu button
- When it opens/closes
- Then it does not block interaction with the add-card control after closing

**Notes / Context:**
Brian reported hamburger still overlaps new card button on desktop; move hamburger to top left.

title: Kanban Light Mode: Fix Header Text Visibility
content:
**User Story:**
As a kanban board user, I want column header text to be readable in light mode so that I can understand the board structure at a glance.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Given the board is in light mode
- When the board renders on desktop and mobile
- Then the column headers (e.g., Backlog, Next Up, Active, Done) have sufficient contrast (WCAG AA for normal text) and are visually readable
- Given I toggle between light mode and dark mode
- When the theme changes
- Then header text and header backgrounds update appropriately without requiring a page refresh
- Given the app loads with a persisted theme preference (if supported)
- When the board first renders
- Then headers are readable immediately (no flash of unreadable text)

**Notes / Context:**
Brian reported header text is invisible in light mode (dark text on dark background).

title: Kanban Mobile: Fix Card Tap to Show Details Modal
content:
**User Story:**
As a mobile user managing tasks, I want to tap on a card to see its full description and details so that I can review task information on my phone.

**Current Problem:**
When tapping a card on mobile devices (Android/iPhone), NOTHING happens. No modal, no details popup, completely unresponsive.

**Expected Behavior:**
Tap card ‚Üí Modal opens with full description, tags, priority, status

**Root Cause:**
Likely desktop-only click handlers, or mobile tap events not attached to cards.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

Given I am on a mobile device (Android or iPhone)
When I tap on any task card
Then a modal should open showing full task details
And I should see: title, description, tags, priority, status, edit/delete buttons

Given the modal is open
When I tap outside the modal or tap close button
Then the modal should close

Given I tap "Edit" in the modal
When I make changes
Then changes should save and modal should close

**Technical Notes:**
- Check if click event listeners work on touch devices
- May need: addEventListener('touchend') in addition to 'click'
- Test on Playwright mobile projects (Pixel 7, iPhone 14 Pro)
- Verify modal z-index is high enough on mobile

**Test Cases:**
1. Tap card on Android ‚Üí Modal opens
2. Tap card on iPhone ‚Üí Modal opens
3. Tap outside modal ‚Üí Modal closes
4. Edit card from mobile modal ‚Üí Saves correctly

**Priority:** CRITICAL - Brian mentioned this twice (first as general mobile issue, now specific to cards)

title: Trip Map: Fix Mobile Responsiveness + Device Detection
content:
**CANCELLED 2026-02-12:** Trip app is perfect as-is. No further work needed.

**User Story:**
As a mobile user planning my trip, I want to tap on map pins and see location details at the bottom of the screen so that I can view restaurant info, addresses, and hours without desktop-only interactions.

**Current Issues:**

1. **Pins Don't Show Info on Mobile Tap:**
   - Tapping pins on mobile doesn't display info panel at bottom
   - Expected: Tap pin ‚Üí Info panel slides up from bottom with location details

2. **No Device Detection:**
   - App doesn't detect mobile vs desktop
   - Desktop interactions (hover, click) don't translate to mobile (tap, long-press)
   - Expected: Responsive behavior based on device type

3. **Missing Mobile Testing:**
   - No Playwright mobile device emulation in test suite
   - Can't verify mobile UX without manual testing
   - Expected: Playwright tests run on mobile viewports (iPhone, Android)

**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Mobile Pin Interaction:**
Given I am on a mobile device (iOS or Android)
When I tap on a restaurant pin
Then an info panel should slide up from the bottom
And show restaurant name, rating, address, hours, distance
And I should be able to swipe down to dismiss the panel

Given I tap on the VRBO pin
Then the VRBO info panel should appear at bottom
And show accommodation name, address, check-in/out dates

**Device Detection:**
Given the app loads on any device
When the viewport width is <768px
Then mobile mode should activate automatically
And touch events should be enabled (tap, swipe, pinch-zoom)
And desktop hover behaviors should be disabled

Given the viewport width is ‚â•768px
Then desktop mode should activate
And click/hover events should work normally

**Playwright Mobile Testing:**
Given the test suite runs
When executing mobile test cases
Then Playwright should emulate:
- iPhone 14 Pro (393x852, iOS)
- Pixel 7 (412x915, Android)
- iPad Air (820x1180, tablet)

And all tests should pass on mobile viewports
And screenshots should capture mobile UI states

**Technical Notes:**
- Use CSS media queries: @media (max-width: 768px)
- Detect touch: 'ontouchstart' in window
- Google Maps: Set gestureHandling: 'greedy' for mobile
- Info panel: Position fixed bottom, transform translateY for slide-up
- Playwright devices: Import from '@playwright/test' ‚Üí devices

**Test Cases:**
1. Load on iPhone ‚Üí Mobile mode active
2. Tap restaurant pin ‚Üí Info panel appears at bottom
3. Tap VRBO pin ‚Üí VRBO info shown
4. Swipe info panel down ‚Üí Panel dismisses
5. Load on desktop ‚Üí Desktop mode active
6. All Playwright tests pass on mobile devices

**Priority:** P0 (CRITICAL) - Mobile users can't use the app effectively

title: Trip Map: Fix Timeline Link + Auto-Center Pins on Day Filter
content:
**CANCELLED 2026-02-12:** Trip app is perfect as-is. No further work needed.

**User Story:**
As a trip planner, I want the Timeline menu link to show a full-screen itinerary list and the map to auto-center on pins when I select a day, so that I can easily view my daily schedule and see all locations without manually panning the map.

**Current Issues:**

1. **Timeline Link Broken:**
   - Timeline link in footer menu doesn't work
   - Timeline link in hamburger menu doesn't work
   - Expected: Clicking Timeline should show full-screen itinerary list view (hides map, shows all days)

2. **Map Doesn't Auto-Center on Day Filter:**
   - When clicking "Wed May 14" (or any day), pins may be off-screen
   - User has to manually scroll/pan to find the pins
   - Expected: Map automatically centers/zooms to show all pins for selected day

**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Timeline Link:**
Given I am viewing the trip map
When I click "Timeline" in the footer menu OR hamburger menu
Then the map should hide
And a full-screen list view of all days should appear
And I should see all itinerary items organized by day
And clicking a day in the list should return to map view with that day selected

**Auto-Center on Day Filter:**
Given I am viewing the trip map
When I click on any day filter (e.g., "Wed May 14")
Then the map should automatically pan and zoom to center all pins for that day
And all markers (VRBO, restaurants, train station) should be visible in viewport
And the zoom level should be appropriate (not too close, not too far)

Given I click "Fri May 9" (Tokyo day)
When the pins load
Then the map should center on Tokyo area
And all 9 restaurants + Tokyo VRBO + train station should be in view

Given I click "Wed May 14" (Osaka day)
When the pins load
Then the map should center on Osaka area
And all 9 restaurants + Osaka VRBO + train station should be in view

**Technical Notes:**
- Use Google Maps fitBounds() or setCenter() + setZoom()
- Calculate bounding box from all visible markers
- Timeline link likely needs event handler attached
- May need to hide map container and show list container

**Test Cases:**
1. Click Timeline link in footer ‚Üí Full list view appears
2. Click Timeline link in hamburger ‚Üí Full list view appears
3. Click day in list view ‚Üí Returns to map with day selected
4. Filter to May 8 ‚Üí Map centers on Tokyo pins
5. Filter to May 14 ‚Üí Map centers on Osaka pins
6. All pins visible without manual panning

**Priority:** P1 (High) - Core UX feature for trip planning

title: Fix Mobileclaw Security - PBKDF2 password hashing
content:
**User Story:**
As a Mobile Agent, I want to implement PBKDF2 password hashing for Mobileclaw so that user passwords are protected against brute-force attacks.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Given user sets a password
- When password is hashed
- Then:
  - PBKDF2 algorithm is used with SHA-256
  - Iteration count is ‚â•100,000 (OWASP recommendation)
  - Random salt is generated for each user (‚â•128 bits)
  - Salt is stored alongside hash
  - Hash is stored securely (not in plain text)
  - Password verification uses constant-time comparison
- Security validation:
  - Passes security audit
  - No timing attacks possible
  - Salt is truly random
- Performance: Hashing completes in <500ms
- Iteration count can be increased in future without breaking existing hashes
- No passwords stored in logs or error messages
- In progress with Mobile Agent

title: Fix Mobileclaw Security - AES-256-GCM encryption
content:
**User Story:**
As a Mobile Agent, I want to implement AES-256-GCM encryption for the Mobileclaw vault so that user data is cryptographically secure.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Given user creates or unlocks vault
- When data is stored in the vault
- Then:
  - All vault data is encrypted with AES-256-GCM
  - Encryption key is derived from user's password using PBKDF2
  - Encrypted data includes authentication tag (GCM mode)
  - Key derivation uses high iteration count (‚â•100,000)
  - Random salt and IV are generated for each encryption
  - No plaintext data is stored on device
  - Encryption/decryption happens in memory
- Security validation:
  - Passes security audit
  - No vulnerabilities in implementation
  - Proper key management
- Performance: Encrypt/decrypt operations complete in <100ms
- Works offline
- In progress with Mobile Agent

content:

As a PM, I want to create a Testing Agent that automatically writes 20 test cases for every feature so that we maintain consistent test coverage across all projects.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Testing Agent capabilities:
  - Reads feature specifications
  - Generates 20 UX test cases per feature
  - Test cases cover: visual hierarchy, touch targets, information architecture, feedback & states, accessibility
  - Test cases follow Given/When/Then format
  - Test cases are saved as Playwright scripts
- Test case quality:
  - Each test is independent and testable
  - Tests cover happy path and edge cases
  - Tests measure objective criteria
  - Tests include expected outcomes
- Agent workflow:
  - Reads FEATURE-SPEC.md
  - Generates TEST-CASES.md
  - Generates Playwright test files
  - Runs tests and generates report
- Agent is documented and can be invoked by team
- Agent outputs are version-controlled

title: Add message reactions and formatting
content:
**User Story:**
As a Mobileclaw user, I want to react to messages with emoji and use text formatting so that I can express myself better in conversations.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Message reactions:
  - Long-press message to show reaction options
  - Common emoji reactions (üëç‚ù§Ô∏èüòÇüòÆüò¢üôè)
  - Custom emoji picker
  - Multiple users can react to same message
  - Reaction count displayed
  - Tap reaction to see who reacted
- Text formatting:
  - Bold: **text** or __text__
  - Italic: *text* or _text_
  - Strikethrough: ~~text~~
  - Code: `code`
  - Code block: ```code```
  - Links auto-detected and clickable

- Markdown syntax supported

title: Add message search and export features
content:
**User Story:**
As a Mobileclaw user, I want to search my message history and export conversations so that I can find information and keep records.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Search features:
  - Search box at top of chat screen
  - Full-text search across all messages
  - Results highlighted in conversation
  - Jump to search result in context
  - Filter by date range, sender, conversation
  - Recent searches saved
- Export features:
  - Export conversation as TXT or PDF
  - Include messages and attachments
  - Preserve formatting and timestamps
  - Export to Files app or share via other apps
  - Option to include or exclude attachments
  - Progress indicator for large exports
- Performance:
  - Search results appear in <1 second
  - Export completes in reasonable time (<30s for 1000 messages)
- Privacy: Exported files are encrypted

title: Implement file upload progress indicators
content:
**User Story:**
As a Mobileclaw user, I want to see upload progress when sending attachments so that I know how long to wait and can cancel if needed.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Upload progress shown for each attachment
- Progress indicator includes:
  - Percentage complete (0-100%)
  - Progress bar or circular indicator
  - File size and uploaded amount (MB)
  - Estimated time remaining
  - Cancel button
- States:
  - Preparing upload (compressing, encrypting)
  - Uploading (with progress)
  - Uploaded (success checkmark)
  - Failed (error icon, retry button)
- Multiple uploads shown simultaneously
- Progress updates in real-time (every 100ms minimum)
- Uploads continue in background
- Notification when upload completes (if app in background)
- Failed uploads can be retried

title: Add typing indicators and read receipts
content:
**User Story:**
As a Mobileclaw user, I want to see when the AI is typing and when my messages are read so that I understand the conversation state.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Typing indicator:
  - Shows when AI is composing response
  - Animated dots or similar visual
  - Appears in conversation footer
  - Disappears when AI sends message
- Read receipts:
  - Checkmark icon when message is sent
  - Double checkmark when message is delivered
  - Blue checkmarks when message is read
  - Timestamp of read status on long-press
- Real-time updates via WebSocket
- Respects user privacy settings (can disable read receipts)
- Performance: Indicator appears within 100ms
- Follows platform conventions (iOS/Android)

title: Add push notifications for new messages
content:
**User Story:**
As a Mobileclaw user, I want push notifications for new messages so that I can respond quickly even when the app is closed.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Push notifications trigger when:
  - New message from AI
  - Message delivery status changes
  - Important system alerts
- Notification includes:
  - Message preview (first 50 characters)
  - Sender (AI or system)
  - Timestamp
  - App icon
- Tapping notification:
  - Opens app to relevant conversation
  - Marks message as read
- Notification settings:
  - Enable/disable push notifications
  - Quiet hours (no notifications)
  - Notification sound selection
- Platform-specific implementation:
  - iOS: APNs
  - Android: FCM
- Works reliably (99% delivery rate)
- Respects system notification preferences

title: Implement local message storage - SQLite for history
content:
**User Story:**
As a Mobileclaw user, I want my chat history stored locally so that I can access past conversations even when offline.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- SQLite database for message storage
- Schema includes:
  - Messages table (id, content, sender, timestamp, status)
  - Conversations table (id, title, created_at, updated_at)
  - Attachments table (id, message_id, file_path, type, size)
- Features:
  - Save messages as they're sent/received
  - Query messages by conversation
  - Search messages (full-text search)
  - Delete messages/conversations
  - Export conversations
- Performance:
  - Fast queries (<100ms)
  - Efficient storage (compress old messages)
  - Database size monitoring
- Data migration:
  - Schema versioning
  - Migration scripts for updates
- Backup/restore capability
- Works offline

title: Design OpenClaw Chat interface - 20 UX test cases
content:

As a Designer Agent, I want to design the OpenClaw Chat interface for Mobileclaw so that users have a delightful, intuitive chat experience.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Design includes:
  - Message bubbles (user, AI, system)
  - Text input field
  - Send button and attachment button
  - Message history
  - Typing indicators
  - Message timestamps
  - Message status indicators
  - Empty states
  - Error states
- 20 UX test cases cover:
  - Visual hierarchy
  - Touch targets
  - Information architecture
  - Feedback & states
  - Accessibility
- Designs for:
  - Light and dark mode
  - Various screen sizes (320px to 428px)
  - Platform-specific patterns (iOS vs Android)
- Interactive prototype or high-fidelity mockups
- Design system components used/created

title: Build attachment system - images, videos, documents, 50MB limit
content:
**User Story:**
As a Mobileclaw user, I want to send images, videos, and documents to OpenClaw so that I can get help with visual or file-based content.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Supported file types:
  - Images: JPG, PNG, GIF, WebP
  - Videos: MP4, MOV
  - Documents: PDF, TXT, MD, DOC, DOCX
- File size limit: 50MB per file
- Features:
  - Pick from gallery
  - Take photo with camera
  - Record video
  - Pick from file system
  - Multiple file selection
  - Thumbnail preview before sending
  - Upload progress indicator
  - Cancel upload
- Uploaded files:
  - Compressed if needed (images/videos)
  - Encrypted during transfer
  - Stored securely on device
  - Linked to message in chat
- Error handling:
  - File too large (show size limit)
  - Unsupported format (show supported types)
  - Upload failed (retry option)
- Works offline (queues uploads)

title: Implement WebSocket client - connect to OpenClaw Gateway
content:
**User Story:**
As a Mobileclaw developer, I want a robust WebSocket client so that Mobileclaw can communicate with OpenClaw Gateway in real-time.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- WebSocket client:
  - Connects to OpenClaw Gateway
  - Handles authentication (tokens, sessions)
  - Maintains persistent connection
  - Reconnects automatically on disconnect
  - Handles connection errors gracefully
- Features:
  - Send messages to gateway
  - Receive messages from gateway
  - Message queuing (offline support)
  - Binary data support (for attachments)
  - Ping/pong for connection health
- Connection states handled:
  - Connecting
  - Connected
  - Disconnected
  - Reconnecting
  - Error
- Performance:
  - Message latency <500ms
  - Minimal battery drain
  - Efficient data usage
- Thorough error handling and logging

title: Build scholarship automation pipeline - weekly finder

As a Scholarship Hunt Pro user, I want an automated pipeline that finds new scholarships weekly so that I don't miss opportunities.

  - Scholarship databases (Fastweb, Scholarships.com, etc.)

  - Organization websites
  - Government sites

  - User's profile (GPA, major, demographics)
  - Eligibility criteria

title: Complete Scholarship Hunt Pro v2.0 - 6-step onboarding
content:

**Acceptance Criteria:**

  2. Create account or sign in

  5. Interests and goals
  6. Scholarship preferences

  - User sees personalized scholarship recommendations

  - User can edit profile anytime in settings

- Mobile-responsive design
- Follows design spec

title: Set up Metricool API - social media scheduling
content:
**User Story:**
As a content manager, I want to integrate Metricool API so that I can schedule and analyze social media posts across multiple platforms from one tool.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Metricool API integration includes:
  - API key configured securely
  - OAuth authentication flow (if required)
  - Connected social accounts (X, Instagram, LinkedIn, etc.)

  - Schedule posts to multiple platforms
  - View scheduled posts
  - Cancel/edit scheduled posts
  - View analytics (reach, engagement)

  - Rate limiting
  - Error handling and retries
  - Pagination for large datasets

- Secrets stored securely (not in code)

title: Rotate GitHub token - create new, update git remote
content:
**User Story:**
As a developer, I want to rotate the GitHub token periodically so that we maintain security best practices and minimize the impact of potential token leaks.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Process for rotation:
  1. Generate new GitHub personal access token
  2. Test new token with test repository
  3. Update token in /root/.openclaw/secrets/keys.env
  4. Update git remote URL with new token
  5. Test git operations (pull, push)
  6. Revoke old token in GitHub
  7. Document rotation date
- New token has same scopes as old token (repo scope minimum)
- All repositories update to use new token
- CI/CD pipelines update automatically or are documented for manual update
- Token expiration set for 6 months from creation
- Rotation documented in changelog
- No disruption to active development

title: Schedule TikTok pipeline cron jobs - 8 AM + 8 PM
content:
**User Story:**
As a content creator, I want the TikTok‚ÜíX pipeline to run automatically at 8 AM and 8 PM so that my content is posted during peak engagement times without manual intervention.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Cron jobs scheduled for:
  - 8:00 AM MST daily
  - 8:00 PM MST daily
- Each cron job:
  - Runs the TikTok‚ÜíX pipeline
  - Checks for new TikTok content
  - Processes and posts to X
  - Logs results
  - Sends notification on completion or errors
- Cron configuration:
  - Uses system cron or OpenClaw scheduler
  - Survives system restarts
  - Handles timezone correctly
- Error handling:
  - Retries on transient failures (3 attempts)
  - Alerts user on persistent failures
  - Logs all errors for debugging
- Can be temporarily disabled without deleting schedule

title: Set up TikTok‚ÜíX content pipeline - OpenAI API key

title: Fix Mobileclaw security - PBKDF2 password hashing
content:
**User Story:**
As a Mobileclaw developer, I want to use PBKDF2 for password hashing so that user passwords are protected against brute-force attacks even if the hash is compromised.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Given user sets a password
- When password is hashed
- Then:
  - PBKDF2 algorithm is used with SHA-256
  - Iteration count is ‚â•100,000 (OWASP recommendation)
  - Random salt is generated for each user (‚â•128 bits)
  - Salt is stored alongside hash
  - Hash is stored securely (not in plain text)
  - Password verification uses constant-time comparison
- Performance: Hashing completes in <500ms
- Iteration count can be increased in future without breaking existing hashes
- Passes security audit
- No passwords stored in logs or error messages

title: Fix Mobileclaw security - AES-256-GCM vault encryption
content:
**User Story:**
As a Mobileclaw user, I want my vault data encrypted with AES-256-GCM so that my sensitive information is secure even if my device is compromised.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Given user creates or unlocks vault
- When data is stored in the vault
- Then:
  - All vault data is encrypted with AES-256-GCM
  - Encryption key is derived from user's password using PBKDF2
  - Encrypted data includes authentication tag (GCM mode)
  - Key derivation uses high iteration count (‚â•100,000)
  - Random salt and IV are generated for each encryption
  - No plaintext data is stored on device
  - Encryption/decryption happens in memory
- Performance: Encrypt/decrypt operations complete in <100ms
- Works offline
- Passes security audit

title: Key Lessons Learned
content:
Key Lessons Learned

### From Task Board Debugging Hell:
- **NEVER blame caching** - Test in fresh browser yourself
- **NEVER trust "it works for me"** - Test what the user sees
- **NEVER silently fail** - Add console.log, check errors
- **ALWAYS simplify** - Remove complexity that fails
- **ALWAYS prove it** - Screenshot showing the fix works

### From Brian's Feedback:
- "Quit fucking around and fix it" = stop making excuses, actually test it
- "Give me a screenshot that shows next up is not z
